definition:
Hamming Distance
================

In comparing two bit patterns, the *Hamming distance* is the count of
bits different in the two patterns. More generally, if two ordered lists
of items are compared, the Hamming distance is the number of items that
do not identically agree. This distance is applicable to encoded
information, and is a particularly simple metric of comparison, often
more useful than the city-block distance or Euclidean distance.

The Hamming distance is a true metric, as it induces a metric space on
the set of ordered lists of some fixed length.
